results.title: Luchak's Easter
results.creator_credit: National Museum of Man, ONF | NFB and Robert Klymasz
results.brief_description: A Ukrainian Easter tradition is celebrated by a Ukrainian-Canadian family in Alberta. Coinciding with the time of Christ’s Resurrection, ceremonies are held in anticipation of the resurrection of those ancestors who have died. The family graveyard is decorated, religious rites are performed, and a family feast is held.

results.title: Lucerne: a stronger shade of green
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Lucerne is one of the richest feed crops grown for livestock and an important source of nitrogen for the soil. In 1977 varieties of aphids began attacking this vital crop. This film shows programs begun by the CSIRO to counter the aphid attacks.

results.title: Lubrication in Industry
results.brief_description: Summary: Describes a lubrication survey for a new hydroelectric plant to highlight the importance of lubrication. shows the lubrication circulating system in operation with the different types of lubrication for different loads, temperatures and speeds

results.title: LT: Year 11
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.

results.title: LSD: insight or insanity?
results.brief_description: Explains the physiological and psychological effect that can result from the unsupervised use of LSD. Touches on the history of hallucinogenic chemicals, the use of LSD and its effects, and the risks of taking LSD. Narrated by Sal Mineo.
results.description: Explains the physiological and psychological effect that can result from the unsupervised use of LSD. Touches on the history of hallucinogenic chemicals, the use of LSD and its effects, and the risks of taking LSD. Narrated by Sal Mineo.

results.title: Loyal tubthumper: Minnie Appleby
results.brief_description: This program is an account of the life of Minnie Appleby (nee Birch) who was born in 1900 and died in 1982. Minnie Appleby’s life story echoes the development of women through this century - she was a suffragette, political speaker, communist activist, housewife, mother, working woman and, later in life, women’s liberationist.

results.title: Loyal to my image
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Alison Wotherspoon and Harriet McKern
results.brief_description: ‘Loyal to my image’ is a powerful documentary about adoption, mothering and personal identity. Through one woman’s experience as an adopted person and also as a mother who relinquishes her child in 1971, this documentary highlights the many complex issues associated with adoption. By structuring Fae’s adoption experience into seven sections: Fantasy, Loss, Virgin/Whore, Institutions, Searching, Identity and Progress, the issues examined include women as mothers, the politics of reproduction, the laws that implement family policy and the control of personal information in our society. At the completion of Fae’s story the documentary questions who is benefitting from the much proclaimed scientific advances in reproductive technology, when infertility is another disease to be cured. Who decides who has the right to mother and what are the emotional, financial and social costs in human terms?

results.title: Lower strings; Brass; Percussion
results.creator_credit: Initial (GB), Jonathan Hewes and Declan Lowney
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Orchestra!”.
This volume of the “Orchestra!” series examines the role of the lower strings: the cello and the double bass. Examines the effect of the invention of the valve on brass instruments and the role of percussion instruments in the orchestra.
